description: From Middle English lyght hertyd, liȝt-hertid, from light (adjective) +‎ herted, hertid (“having a disposition”, adjective) (equivalent to light +‎ hearted), from the noun herte. See more at light, heart, -ed.

adjectives.description: lighthearted (comparative more lighthearted, superlative most lighthearted)

entries.meaning: Joyful, glad, taking pleasure in being alive; not depressed or sad.
examples: The lighthearted young lovers ran over the hills.

entries.meaning: Enjoyably lacking of seriousness, not grave.
examples: His lighthearted banjo performance was appreciated because it relieved the tension in tight situations.
